title: Bug 49195: Error message is printed when using port 1 as shutdown port with Windows service
description: When specifying <Server port="1" in server.xml, an error message is printed in the catalina.20100427.log file. However, Tomcat still stops correctly. It seems that when the service launcher stops Tomcat, Catalina server is not null. Possible improvements could be using wait(10000) instead of sleep(10000) in StandardServer.await(), or using an interrupt() call to wake the thread up if it is known.
OB:
When using port 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service, the following error message is printed in the catalina.20100427.log file:

27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServer
SEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.

Despite the error message, Tomcat stops correctly.

It appears that when the service launcher stops Tomcat, the Catalina server is not null.
EB: Instead of using sleep(10000), it would be better to use wait(10000) in the StandardServer.await() method. This would allow the thread to be woken up by a notifyAll() call. Another option is to use the interrupt() method to wake up the thread if it is known.
